article: Edith Cavell was born on December 4, 1865, in England. When she left school, she became a teacher. Edith soon found that she had a  _  for nursing , so she completed her training  _  any problem. In 1907, a doctor invited Edith to open a  _  school for nurses in Belgium . In August 1914, Germany invaded Belgium. By then, the training school had become a Red Cross hospital. It required its nurses to care for injured soldiers from every country---even  _  soldiers. . German forces went through Belgium to France. British soldiers were  _  with the French, trying to  _  the Germans out of France. But they didn't  _  . As a result, many British and French soldiers would be caught. But some of them found their  _  to Edith's training school. There, she took care of them and  _  them from the German forces. Then she heard some  _  people were willing to help the soldiers escape. Together they organized travels for the soldiers out of Belgium to Holland, which was a safe country during the whole war. In august 1915, the German government discovered  _  was happening at Edith's training school. Edith was  _  for helping about two hundred British and French  _  escape. Early on October 12, 1915, Edith Cavell was  _  . She died for her country, but she believed that she had only been a nurse trying to do her  _  . History will remember her for ever.
